basic_info.official_name: Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for Foreign Students Tenable in Brunei Darussalam (BDGS) Academic Session 2025/2026
basic_info.provider: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brunei Darussalam

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students (foreign students). Not eligible for Brunei Darussalam Permanent Residents. The scholarship is intended primarily for international students. Some sources mention OIC Member States as a target group, but general international student eligibility is also stated.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines/fields of study including Arts, Sciences, Engineering, Islamic Studies, Business, Humanities, Specific Education, Fine Arts.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: No general GPA requirement explicitly stated, but applicants must have excellent academic records. For undergraduate entry, a minimum qualification of Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in Senior level is mentioned.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, Postgraduate Master’s Degree. PhD programmes are not offered under the BDGS scholarship.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Must provide an English test. IELTS score of 6.0 or a TOEFL minimum score of 550. Other language tests are not required.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants applying to Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete an online application through UBD's admission portal. Scholarship recipient is not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship. Upon completion of the programme, the scholarship recipient will be required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect (return to country of origin). Application form must be duly completed and endorsed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs or the relevant agency responsible for the Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship in your country.

background_and_logistics.official_website: https://www.mfa.gov.bn/pages/online-bdgs.aspx (Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brunei Darussalam). Specific email for scholarship inquiries: tad.scholarship@mfa.gov.bn.
background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form, Reference Letter (C1 and C2), English test scores (IELTS/TOEFL), High school diploma/equivalent (for Undergraduate), Bachelor's degree (for Postgraduate).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: An applicant may be required to appear for an interview. Successful candidates will be notified in late 2025 (for 2025/2026 session).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The scholarship is offered annually under a special scholarship award scheme. Tenable for the minimum period required to obtain the specific degree (e.g., four years for a First Degree). Eligible institutions include: Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025/2026 academic session were open around January 26, 2025, with a deadline of February 15, 2025. The official MFA website currently states applications for 2025/2026 are closed.

basic_info.official_name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark)
basic_info.provider: University of Southern Denmark (SDU), Ministry of Higher Education and Science

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is fully funded, covering full tuition fees and providing a monthly stipend for living expenses. It offers full and partial tuition waivers, and covers living costs.

timeline_info.application_deadline: For February intake: 15 October 2025; For September intake: 1 March 2026 (or 01 February 2026). Other deadlines mentioned include 8th January 2026 and 1st February 2026.
timeline_info.opening_date: Applications typically open in July for the spring intake (February start).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: A very limited number of scholarships are offered; the exact number is not specified.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: The scholarship is open to international students from non-EU/EEA countries/citizens. Applicants must be highly qualified, demonstrate academic excellence, and have a strong motivation to study. Admission to a Danish university is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Specific Master’s degree programs at the Sønderborg campus (e.g., MSc in Engineering – Mechatronics) or programmes offered on the new campus in Vejle.
field_restrictions.restrictions: This scholarship is only offered for Master's degree programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: SDU does not publish a minimum GPA, but a strong academic performance, especially in relevant subjects, is expected. A GPA equivalent to 7.0 or higher in the Danish grading scale is mentioned for quota 1 bachelor admissions, which may be indicative.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Applicants must be pursuing or enrolled in a Master's degree program and provide evidence of an undergraduate degree.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language proficiency is required. A TOEFL score of 575/230/88 is mentioned, however, one source states no IELTS is needed. This information is conflicting.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Reference letters (or letters of recommendation) are required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: There is no strict upper age limit; eligibility depends on academic qualifications and program-specific requirements.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: A motivation letter or statement of purpose is required. Applicants must apply for an eligible Master’s program through the SDU portal; a separate scholarship application is not needed. Incomplete or late applications will not be eligible.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts and degree certificates (evidence of undergraduate degree), proof of English language proficiency, statement of purpose or motivation letter, Curriculum Vitae (CV/resume), and reference letters.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The SDU Danish Government Scholarship acknowledges the important impact of non-EU/EEA students, presenting a transformative chance for them to pursue postgraduate education. It is a merit-based scholarship.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications typically open in July for the spring intake (February start). The Autumn semester begins September 2026.

covered_expenses: monthly stipend and accommodation amounting to 16,000 Baht

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students; all excellent students; ASEAN and Non-ASEAN students; Thai natives are not eligible; students from all countries can apply; recipients are not permitted to postpone a period of the scholarship acceptance.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters from the Head, the Director or the Dean
additional_requirements.career_plan: Study plan / description of academic interests

application_documents: Copy of Certificate of Graduation and an official transcript of academic records
Study plan / description of academic interests
One 1-inch-colored photos (with blue background) taken no more than six months in polite attire, signed on the reverse side, one of which should be attached to the application form
Two recommendation letters from the Head, the Director or the Dean
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The award duration is 2 Years for Masters Degree and 3 Years for Doctoral Degree. The university was officially established by King Vajiravudh on 26 March 1917 and named after his father King Chulalongkorn as he launched a policy to promote education to adapt the country to the developing world and prevent colonization. Chulalongkorn University is a public and autonomous research university, one of Thailand’s most prestigious institutions.

basic_info.provider: Chinese Scholarship Council (CSC), Chinese Ministry of Education

funding_info.funding_details: Divided into full scholarship and partial scholarship. Monthly allowances: Undergraduate students: CNY 2,500 per month; Master's students/general scholars: CNY 3,000 per month; Doctoral students/senior scholars: CNY 3,500 per month.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 14, 2026 (general, via campuschina.org); December 31st, 2025 (Stage 1 for Harbin Institute of Technology); February 12, 2025 (for Israel embassy)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be citizens of a country other than the People's Republic of China and be in good health both mentally and physically. For the 'Silk Road' program, applicants must be nationals of countries belonging to the 'One Belt One Road' initiative. For the Chinese Universities-Postgraduate Program, it is open to all nationalities. Applicants must not have finished their previous study within China or it has been at least a year since they completed their previous study if it was completed in China. Specific academic and age requirements apply based on the study level.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diverse fields such as science, engineering, agriculture, medicine, economics, law, as well as non-degree Chinese language studies. Available for undergraduate, master’s, and PhD studies.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Some restrictions may apply to specific fields or disciplines.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum 2.5 GPA or above (for Grade 12 Higher School Certificate, Papua New Guinea specific); Minimum 60% average (excluding Life Orientation, South Africa specific). General advice suggests GPA/CGPA 3.7+ for a strong application.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Intermediate/A-level/FA-FSC (12 years) for Bachelors; Bachelor's degree holder for Masters; Master's degree holder for PhD; National Senior Certificate (or equivalent) for non-degree Chinese language studies.

experience_requirements.min_years: At least 3 years' work experience (preferred for some programs)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English or Mandarin required. HSK Level 3 (180) for Chinese-taught undergraduate/general scholar programs and Bachelor's applicants (Silk Road); HSK 4 (180) for Chinese-taught Master's/Ph.D. applicants (Silk Road). IELTS (academic) 6.5; TOEFL 90 (MyBestTM Score and essentials accepted); Duolingo 120; GRE General 320; GMAT 550.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors (for graduate programs or senior scholar programs).
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 25 for Undergraduate/Bachelors; Under 35 for Master's; Under 40 for Doctoral; Under 45 for General Scholar program. Age limits are based on degree level.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants planning to stay in China for more than 6 months must submit a photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form. Successful scholarship applicants from South Africa are required to sign a contract and return to South Africa upon completion of their studies. A pre-admission document issued by the universities applying is required.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must be applying for Masters or Ph.D. level (for Chinese Universities-Postgraduate Program).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Signed application forms, attested educational documents (notarized diploma, transcripts), CNIC/B-form (Pakistan specific), passport copy, study plan, language certificate (valid HSK reports), physical examination form, recommendation letters, pre-admission document. Documents must be submitted in PDF format.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Scholarship applicants accepted by Chinese institutions are officially confirmed as Chinese Government Scholarship students with endorsement from the Ministry of Education of China. Admission letters are typically issued in June or July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Chinese Government Scholarship is awarded by the Chinese Scholarship Council (CSC) to international students in Chinese universities. It supports study at more than 280 Chinese universities. Programs include 'Silk Road' Program, 'Chinese University Program', and 'Great Wall Program'.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Academic year 2025-2026. Application periods vary by program and embassy, with deadlines observed in February and December for specific programs/years. Admission letters are issued in June or July.

funding_info.funding_details: The program provides tuition-free education, a monthly stipend, accommodation contribution, and medical insurance. For doctoral level, the monthly stipend is HUF 140,000 (approx. EUR 365) for the first phase (4 semesters) and HUF 180,000 (approx. EUR 470) for the second phase (4 semesters), for 12 months a year until completion of studies. Accommodation contribution is HUF 40,000 per month or a free dormitory place.

timeline_info.opening_date: Application for 2025/2026 academic year has started; expected to open around mid-November 2025 for 2026/2027 academic year.
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Nearly 4,500 scholarships were awarded in 2025. Thousands are awarded each year.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students (non-Hungarian citizens or dual citizens including Hungarian). Applicants must be in good mental and physical health. Eligibility is determined by educational cooperation programs between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner. Self-financed/fee-paying students already studying in a Hungarian higher education institution at the same study level are eligible only if recommended by their Hungarian host universities. Outstanding academic performance at previous level of education is required.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Study fields vary by sending country/territory and are determined by educational cooperation programs. Examples for full degree master studies include Agricultural Sciences, Arts and Humanities, Social Science, Computer Science and Information Technology, Legal Science, Economic Science, Engineering Science, Medical and Health Science, Sport Science, Natural Science, Arts, Art Education, Political Science and Public Governance. Partial studies at master level cover similar fields.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible to apply only for scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programmes in effect between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Bachelor's degree upper second-class honors level for Master's applicants (specific advert for 2026). A general application status requires a minimum of 56 points on a 100-point scale.
academic_requirements.required_degree: HSSC/Intermediate or equivalent for Bachelor's/One-Tier programs. 16 years Bachelor's degree or equivalent for Master's programs. 17/18 years Degree or equivalent for PhD programs.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language requirements vary by program and institution. Examples include: IELTS minimum overall band 6.0 (for International Business Economics), TOEFL iBT minimum 80 points (for International Business Economics), TOEFL iBT minimum 60 points (for BA Performance), IELTS Academic minimum 5.0 (for BA Performance), Cambridge minimum 154 points (for BA Performance). Study programs are generally available in English and Hungarian, with some in German, French, or other foreign languages. A Hungarian as a foreign language and culture course is compulsory for all scholarship holders starting in or after Fall 2020.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Letter of recommendation requirements depend on the school and program.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Below 38 years of age for Master's applicants (specific advert for 2026).
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: No specific gender requirement, but gender balance is recommended to be considered if multiple applications are submitted.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students at Risk Subprogramme supports Ukrainian citizens who cannot study in war-affected areas, or students whose education/research has been halted due to war or natural disaster.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation Letter (minimum 1 page, typed in Times New Roman 12-point). Some applicants may require a recommendation from a federation (e.g., sports).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online application form, Motivation Letter, Proof of language proficiency, Passport or National ID, Final degree and transcript (to be submitted before August 01, 2025), Letter of recommendation (requirements vary).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are informed about results by their country's ministry of education or national scholarship office/agency. Applicants should be prepared to discuss academic background, reasons for choosing Hungary, and planned contributions to the academic community (implying an interview).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013 for foreign students. Nearly 12,000 Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders are currently studying in Hungary on different programmes and degree levels around the country.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2025/2026 academic year have started. The call for applications for 2025/2026 has been published. The online application system for 2026/2027 is expected to open around mid-November 2025.

funding_info.funding_details: Türkiye Scholarships is a comprehensive, government-funded, competitive scholarship program offering fully funded education and covering everything international students need during their academic studies and stay in Türkiye.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (up to 9000 TL per month mentioned for some programs)

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 20th (annually, e.g., February 20, 2025 for 2025 intake, February 20, 2026 for 2026 intake)
timeline_info.opening_date: January 10th (annually, e.g., January 10, 2025 for 2025 intake, January 2026 for 2026 intake)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Around 5,000 new scholarships awarded each year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Türkiye Scholarships is a government-funded, competitive scholarship program awarded to outstanding international students and researchers from all over the world (excluding Turkish citizens) to pursue full-time or short-term programs at top universities in Türkiye. Eligibility is assessed based on the candidate's academic success, social activities, and motivation related to the chosen field.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Wide range of academic programs including engineering, social sciences, health sciences, basic sciences, humanities, natural sciences, performing arts, music, and fine arts. Specific fields such as social sciences, engineering, or development studies are also mentioned.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: For undergraduate programs, a minimum of 70% in high school is typically required. For graduate and doctoral programs, academic standards are required. A minimum GPA of 2.2 (about 55%) from bachelor's studies is mentioned for general admission to master's programs in Turkish universities.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, and short-term research programs

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency certificates such as TOEFL (minimum 72 for undergraduate, 79 for graduate) or IELTS (minimum 5.5 for undergraduate) may be required. Turkish Proficiency Certificate is also accepted. No Turkish proficiency is required initially, but English proficiency may be needed. Applications can be submitted in 8 languages including Turkish, Arabic, and English.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: One or two letters of recommendation (academic or professional) are required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A well-written motivation letter or letter of intent/personal statement explaining goals for studying in Türkiye is required.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 21 years for undergraduate programs, under 30 years for master’s programs, under 35 years for PhD programs, and under 50 years for Research Scholarships.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be a citizen of any country other than Turkey. Applicants must generally not be currently enrolled in a Turkish university at the same level of study they are applying for. However, the official website also states that 'Individuals who are currently enrolled in programs in Turkish universities at the level of education will apply' for certain eligible groups/programs. Required documents include CNIC/Passport.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CNIC/Passport, Language proficiency certificates (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS, or Turkish Proficiency Certificate), Motivation letter/Letter of intent/Personal statement, Letters of recommendation (academic or professional).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applications are considered based on academic success, social activities, and motivation related to the chosen field. Interviews are carried out in more than 100 countries.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Türkiye Scholarships is a government-funded, competitive scholarship program offering free higher education and a new life experience at prestigious Turkish universities. It aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties by welcoming talented international students and researchers. The program brings together leaders of the future.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications are received in one period, typically between January 10th and February 20th annually. The interview process is conducted from April to June.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded, comprehensive financial support, generous benefits, promotes international cooperation and academic exchange.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must meet specific requirements; aimed at high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership; must meet academic, language, and documentation requirements. Not residing or having started postgraduate studies in Colombia. Not having been a beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program. Open to foreign professionals.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization degree scholarships in a variety of degrees and academic disciplines. Priority areas include scientific research, technology, and innovation.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 4.0 on the Colombian scale of 1 to 5 (or at least 4 out of 5)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (university degree or bachelor) for Master's applicants. Master's degree for PhD applicants.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: professional experience in their field of study

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English language Proficiency is not Mandatory

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recent academic letter of reference from a university professor where the applicant finished his/her bachelor degree (letter should be dated 2019 for a past call).
additional_requirements.age_limits: between 25-49 years old (or not more than 50 years of age)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: If selected, change of academic program or university is not allowed. For academic programs longer than 12 months (master and doctorate), the scholar must request an extension for the second year. Not having been a beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: International students from all over the world. Not residing or having started postgraduate studies in Colombia prior to applying.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Verified copies of Educational Transcripts, University certificate- transcript (English/Spanish), Recent academic letter of reference, document confirming applicant hasn’t been living in Colombia prior to applying.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Scholarships are for Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization degrees. Maximum duration: twelve (12) months for specialization, twenty-four (24) months for master, and up to thirty-six (36) months for doctorate. Awarded on an annual term.

basic_info.provider: Thailand Government Scholarship (TIPP), Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA), Thai Universities/Academic Institutions

funding_info.funding_details: Fully Funded Scholarships, 100% tuition coverage, full funding with stipends, full scholarships covering travel, accommodation and subsistence expenses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Scholarships for international students from developing countries. Candidates must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or relevant central government agencies. Civil servants must fulfill BCSR 2023 criteria. Applicants outside civil service must fulfill criteria prescribed by the Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diverse fields of study aligning with Thailand’s expertise and global development goals, including six key areas: Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Agriculture and Food Security, Public Health, Bio-Circular-Green Economy Model (BCG). Specific programs mentioned: Master of Science in Occupational and Environmental Health, Master of Primary Health Care Management, Master of Science Program in Parasitology, Master of Science Program in Tropical Medicine, Master of Science Program in Science.

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum 2-3 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience with the nominating agency; relevant current work

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English test score (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) as required by the academic institution. Typical postgraduate IELTS score range: 6.5 - 7.0 overall. Alternatives like Duolingo English Test, PTE, or 12th-grade English scores (>70%) may be accepted by some programs or institutions, or an English language proficiency certificate.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recommendation Letter from at least 2 persons (1 person per letter), e.g., university.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Essay defining short-term and long-term academic and career goals.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No more than 45 years of age.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Candidates must have good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Relevant qualification requirements; meet academic standards and language requirements set by Thai scholarship programs.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: TIPP application form (online and hard copy), other related documents, English test score (if required), recommendation letters, essay on academic/career goals. Specific documents may be required by the academic institution.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Introduced in 2000 as a framework for providing postgraduate scholarships for developing partners. Aims to build global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and allow participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and warm hospitality. It is a framework under Thailand International Development Cooperation (TIDC) to exchange experiences and best practices for sustainable development.

basic_info.provider: Flemish Ministry of Education and Training (Government of Flanders)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship. Includes a grant of €10,000 (or €10,020) and a tuition fee waiver per academic year. The grant amount is €10,000 for 2024-2025 and 2025-2026 academic years.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Varies by institution and academic year. Examples: 15 January 2025 (for 2025-2026, KU Leuven); 1 February 2025 (for 2025-2026, UAntwerp); 27 April 2025 (general for 2025); 15 January 2026 (for 2026-2027, KU Leuven); March 15, 2026 (general for 2026).
timeline_info.opening_date: October 15, 2025 (for 2026-2027, KU Leuven); November (general start for scholarship application).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Up to 45 scholarships annually (5 reserved for American students); 30 scholarships awarded by the Flemish government for 2026 intake.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding international students from all countries applying for a Master's degree program at a participating Flemish higher education institution. Students must be accepted by the host institution. Previous degree cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution, but credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) in Flanders is allowed. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible. Cannot be combined with other Flemish Government or Erasmus Mundus scholarships. The Flemish institution of choice must participate in the Master Mind Scholarships. 5 scholarships are reserved for American students.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programs in Humanities and Social Sciences, Science, Engineering, Law and Criminology, Social Sciences, Business and Economics, Arts and Humanities, Medicine. Various study fields are offered, check university websites for eligible programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Specific programs may be ineligible for the 2024-2025 academic year (list not provided).

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.5 out of 4.0 (or equivalent).
academic_requirements.required_degree: A previous degree (e.g., Bachelor's) obtained outside a Flemish higher education institution, required for Master's program enrollment.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Excellent English language skills required. Minimum IELTS overall band score of 7.0; minimum TOEFL total score of 94; or C1 level on the Certificate in Advanced English.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two signed letters of recommendation from professors of previous home university, University of Applied Sciences, School of Arts, or recent employer.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A letter of motivation explaining career goals and how the scholarship will help achieve them.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Age limit of 30 years for Master's students by the time of application.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: 5 scholarships reserved exclusively for American students.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Cannot be combined with other scholarships from the Flemish Government or Erasmus Mundus. Applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic performance and/or potential.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Complete application file for an eligible Master’s programme, academic transcripts, KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven), two signed letters of recommendation, letter of motivation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Candidates first apply for admission to an eligible Flemish host institution. The host institution preselects candidates and starts the scholarship application procedure by creating a candidate's file in the Mobility-Online tool. Nominated students may then need to complete an online Master Mind application of the Flemish Government. The scholarship is highly competitive.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Prestigious, fully funded scholarship program lasting one academic year for 60 ECTS Master’s programs or two academic years for 120 ECTS Master’s programs. Offered by several Flemish higher education institutions, including five universities and seven universities of applied sciences and arts.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are open at some institutions (e.g., KU Leuven). The call for the 2025-2026 academic year has closed at some institutions (e.g., UAntwerp).

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: 60 scholarships awarded annually for one year of full-time study at the master's or PhD level. Each scholarship includes a stipend of €10,000 and a full tuition fee waiver from the host institution. Applicants must ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover other costs while studying in Ireland.
covered_expenses: €10,000 stipend for one year of full-time study

timeline_info.opening_date: Open for applications for the 2025/2026 academic year

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding non-EU/EEA/Switzerland/UK students. Applicants must have a domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom. Must have a conditional or final offer of admission to a full-time Level 9 (postgraduate programme) or Level 10 (PhD) at an eligible Irish higher education institution. Must be an international, fee-paying student. Applicants who have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again. Applicants should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement.

field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants applying for a research master’s scholarship must not currently hold, or have previously held, a Council Postgraduate Scholarship. Applicants applying for a PhD degree scholarship must not currently hold or have previously held, any Council Postgraduate Scholarship other than those which would enable them to obtain a research master’s degree.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: A GPA of at least 3.5/4.0 or more is the minimum requirement for most scholarships in Ireland. Aim for a minimum 70% or 3.0+ GPA (A-grade for best chances).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of English proficiency is required. General university requirements for Ireland include: IELTS (minimum 6.0-6.5 overall, with some universities like Trinity College Dublin and UCD requiring 6.5+), TOEFL iBT (minimum 90+, with some universities like Trinity College Dublin and UCD requiring 90+), Duolingo (110-120+ for some universities like UCD and Trinity College Dublin).

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal statement, strong motivation for studying in Ireland, prior experience (as a primary assessment criterion).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts and certificates, proof of English proficiency, recommendation letters, personal statements, conditional or final offer of admission. Additional documents include: GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, and Application Help Document.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Primary assessment criteria include prior experience, personal statement, and references. Selection is based on academic excellence, leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious initiative and the country's flagship funding offer to international students, designed to attract top-tier international students to Irish higher education institutions. It is administered by the Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA).
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for the 2025/2026 academic year, supporting one year of full-time study.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship covering tuition fees, a monthly stipend (around €900), and health/medical/accident insurance. Some sources also mention accommodation and airfare.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens living abroad and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must not be residing in Italy. Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and knowledge of the Italian or English language. Applicants must not be enrolled in other degree programs during their study and the grant is incompatible with any other grant from the Italian Government or other Italian public institutions (including DSU grants).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's degrees, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, PhD programs, research under academic supervision, undergraduate programs, and Italian language or cultural courses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Not eligible if currently enrolled in another degree program. Incompatible with any other Italian government scholarship or grants from Italian public institutions (e.g., DSU grants).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Relevant bachelor’s degree for Master's programs. Master’s degree for Doctoral programs. Appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the chosen Italian University/Institute.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Italian B2 (CEFR) for Italian-taught programs. English B2 (CEFR) for English-taught programs. Italian A2 (CEFR) for Italian language and culture courses.

additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor’s Degree: ≤ 23 years old. Master’s Degree/AFAM/Italian Language and Culture Courses: ≤ 28 years old by the deadline (with exceptions for renewals). PhD Programs: ≤ 30 years old by the deadline (with exceptions for renewals).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Age limits have exceptions for renewals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants for PhD programs are required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University. Admission letter from the university in Italy is generally required. Applicants must be of age.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Admission letter from an Italian university (especially for PhD), certificate of Italian/English language proficiency (if applicable), personal statement (max 1000 words), score statement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic merit, motivation, and language proficiency (Italian or English). A final ranking is published.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI) to strengthen international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language and higher education system, and support Italy’s economic system worldwide. Aims to foster cultural exchange and academic cooperation.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are awarded for 3, 6, or 9 months, depending on the course type. Multi-year degree course scholars may be eligible for renewal if academic progress is satisfactory.

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship can be full or partial. It covers full tuition fees, comprehensive insurance (CNY 800/year), and a one-time allowance for new students (CNY 800). Living allowance is approximately CNY 1700/month (or ¥20,000 annually) for Master's and PhD students. It also provides financial assistance to cover materials, accommodation, and other study-related expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Tianjin University: May 31, 2025 (for Bachelor and Master programs); Tianjin Normal University: June 30, 2025

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students (non-Chinese citizens) in good mental and physical health. The scholarship is open to both prospective and current international students pursuing undergraduate, master's, or Ph.D. programs in Tianjin. Applicants must be self-funded international students applying for or already enrolled at eligible universities in Tianjin. Previous recipients of the Tianjin Government Scholarship are not eligible.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above, or GPA over 2.8/4 or 3.5/5 or 70/100

experience_requirements.min_years: At least three years of work experience (for applicants with a bachelor's degree or higher, specific to some programs/universities)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Chinese-taught programs: HSK Level 5 with a minimum score of 180. For English-taught programs: English Proficiency Certificates (e.g., TOEFL 80 or IELTS).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation (for Master's and Doctoral applicants)
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Personal Statement (including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths) written in Chinese or English (no less than 800 words for Master/Doctor, no less than 300 words for Bachelor); Original No Crime Certificate; Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy); Passports with a validity period of six months or more; Admission Letter; Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201); Study Experience Resume.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form; Application Form for Foreigners Wishing to Study at Tianjin University (for TJU applicants); Personal Statement/Study Plan; Admission Letter; Application Form for Visa to China (JW202 or JW201); Physical Examination Report/Foreigner Physical Examination Form; Passports; Original No Crime Certificate; Chinese or English Proficiency Certificate (HSK, TOEFL, IELTS); Study Experience Resume; Two letters of recommendation.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must pass the international student review at the host university and be pre-admitted to be eligible for nomination. The assessment results are publicized for one week and then submitted to the Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. The Scholarship List is determined by experts organized by the Commission. Admission results are announced and documents (Admission Notice, JW202) sent to winners from July 1 to August 31 (for Tianjin University).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is established by the Tianjin Municipal Government to sponsor talented international students for undergraduate and postgraduate studies in Tianjin. It provides an opportunity to receive an internationally respected education in a vibrant, rapidly growing city. It is a one-year scholarship, renewable annually based on academic performance and compliance with university policies.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications for Tianjin University are accepted from October 15, 2024, to May 31, 2025. Scholarship winners receive admission results and documents between July 1 and August 31.
